Topic.Title: NVIDIA expects to announce Grey and Wayne at CES 2012, vendors will announce products at MWC in February

Message.Msg: They will announce Wayne for sure but not Grey. On the last earnings call Jensen said that they hope to tape out Grey this quarter. So the earliest it comes back from the fab is Jan-Mar.

Topic.Title: NVIDIA expects to announce Grey and Wayne at CES 2012, vendors will announce products at MWC in February

Message.Msg: Mediatek (china) is expected to sell 110M ARM chips next year. And this is not Qualcomm. Most of the tegra's that Nvidia sells are tegra2's. No one wants tegra3 and tegra4. There are so many ARM chip manufacturers now, that Nvidia is like 10th in ARM's race. BAD Indeed!!.

Topic.Title: NVIDIA expects to announce Grey and Wayne at CES 2012, vendors will announce products at MWC in February

Message.Msg: So what's this now -- the sixth (6th) or seventh (7th) re-announcement for Wayne? I've lost track. Of the number of of spec sheet-less, working prototype-less and most importantly, Launch Partner-less announcements for the badly delayed Wayne. There oughta be a law, you know. Yes boys, and industry standardized Law. That says you can't have more than three (3) announcements for vaporware parts without actually showing the working goods, and a Genuine Launch Partner willing to actually buy said goods. After three announcements, said vaporware should be deemed to be Shopworn Goods -- and further re-announcements are not permitted. And no. Those free engineering-sample-receivers shouldn't count as Genuine Launch Partners. Oh no no no. They're not actually "partners" -- they're more like hoes, but paid in parts. Which would eliminate Asus and ZTE as Jen's perennial "launch partners". It's sad you know. Oh so sad. That Jen has absolutely Nothing ready to launch at the 2013 CES. Absolutely Nothing, boys. So he's forced to re-announce at the CES what's already been announced and re-announced five (5) times or so. Most disturbing is that Jen STILL has no real Launch Partner for the Wayne chip. Plenty of announcements now -- but no Genuine Launch Partner.

Topic.Title: Try this again - NVIDIA DARPA Contract

Message.Msg: Dude whatever intellectual property discovered working for DARPA will become the property of NVDA. The govt. can use the results ,on govt. work only, for free. All commercial applications will be under NVDA's terms as they will own the intellectual property. This is a nice win. Free R@D.

Thursday 12/13 - #70 Friday 12/14 - #37 Sat 12/15 - #17 Sun 12/16 - #12 In Store Availability in my Metropolitan Area Thursday 12/13 - 1 store out of 20 Friday - 12/14 - 12 out of 20 Sat - 12/15 - 17 out of 20 Sun -12/16 -17 out 20 Note: All Staple stores in my metropolitan area had inventory Thursday morning. Topic.Title: NVIDIA expects to announce Grey and Wayne at CES 2012, vendors will announce products at MWC in February

Message.Msg: 'announcing spec', you mean paper launch? no, I take it back, announcing spec is even less than paper launch. Now paper launch, that will be like T3 - 'announced' in Jan '11, couldn't even yield anything till full 5Qs later. Tape out now, if you think that chip will be working before th 2H of '13 - you ain't been around silicon at all. Nvda has got zero experience in integrating 'cheap' radios. If you think they can get it right the first pass, buy more shares! If nvda can get that thing working by the 3rd pass, I will say they are doing reasonably good, they got it to work. 'Pass' defined as all layer change to alter layout so that 'cheap' radio won't have interference problems. If you had listened to brcm analyst day's wireless presentation, you would have found that sometimes, even with the undisputed leadeer in integrating as 'cheap' radios, they have to go for a second pass for things to work. Like I said, you think otherwise, you have not been around silicon.

Topic.Title: Try this again - NVIDIA DARPA Contract

Message.Msg: My reading is that progress will be measured by response in a synthetic environment, the equivalent of pre-recorded scenes. They won't be designing chips, but rather learning how much processing power will be needed in an embedded system. Not that they will be writing "simulated spec sheets for simulated parts".

Topic.Title: NVIDIA "Grey" processor has been upgraded to Wayne + i500 LTE

Message.Msg: If you are referring to the lack of an integrated baseband component in their SoC - I tend to agree but keep in mind that they are way ahead of all the traditional chip manufactures not only in terms of product but in technology - SDR will be the standard. Now, if you are talking about the lack of progress on the mobile GPU/Processor I would say; maybe, but considering that they still have beaten out Qualcomm and TI on many fronts and earned many large profile wins, all things considered, I would say there is some distinct intangibles or points of differentiation that the others simply can't compete with that. If you've listen to Jame's talk, the one being referred to in the subject line of this post, on the matter it's the system down approach that delivers the real "value add" and differentiation. It's not the clock speed, not transistor cluster, or any other minute technical hardware detail that matters but the ecosystem and ancillary technology gives them the edge. I agree their is something for being first but having that ecosystem is an intangible that nobody really considers - MS is still the standard in the enterprise not because it has great or "better" products per say but in large part because their technology is where a vast majority of trained technical talent is trained on.

Topic.Title: Nvidia as an Acquisition Target: Pros and Cons

Message.Msg: I'm glad you enjoyed my piece!

Topic.Title: Nvidia as an Acquisition Target: Pros and Cons

Message.Msg: "With Tegra, there is also the problem of commoditization of CPU and GPU cores by the likes of ARM Holdings and Imagination Technologies." CPU cores from ARM Holdings and GPU cores from ARM and Imagination make it very simple for a semiconductor firm with its own fabrication plants, such as Samsung, to develop its own highly competent solutions. "The value proposition of such an acquisition also Falls Off Of A Cliff when we consider that *** Nvidia’s mobile GPUs are not yet truly competitive *** with the best from Imagination and ARM." "Nvidia’s mobile GPUs are not yet truly competitive." HA HA HA HA HA HA! What a hack writer. How on earth can Anyone write about Jen's Tegra folly without mentioning the inescapable Fact that the Tegra/Consuming Profits Business has LOST (-$233,545,000.00) for the Nine Months ending October 28, 2012. And is easily on track to LOSE (-$311,000,000.00) this year. Yes boys, nearly One Third of a Billion Dollars -- to be Lost -- just this year alone. By Jen's Tegra/Consuming Profits Business folly. Or the inconvenient Fact that Jen's Tegra/Consuming Profits Business has wiped-out 32.5% of nvidia's Operating Income, for the first nine months of 2012. Yes boys, One Third of nvidia's Operating Profits are eaten-up by the Tegra losses. Munch munch munch munch. Why, it would take not only a Hack Writer to completely miss these crucial deal-breaking, poison pill-like Facts -- the writer would also need to be quite BLIND. Yes boys, Certifiably Blind with a dog and a white cane and dark sunglasses. Or more likely -- be Paid to deliberately spin the inconvenient Horrific Facts. Which are that nobody -- repeat Nobody -- wants to buy a business that is Losing One Third of a Billion U.S. Dollars annually. Nobody. "Nvidia’s mobile GPUs are not yet truly competitive." HA HA HA HA HA HA! What a Certifiably Blind Hack Writer.

Message.Msg: Sorry boys, about that lump in your pump. It's like a small round stone, right? It sure is. You know. How when a Elephant snorks-up water with his trunk. But sometimes gets a small round stone stuck in their snorker part. And can't pump. 'Till they blow the small round stone out of their snorker-upper part. It's like that. A lump in your pump.
